channel.title: Bits, Bytes, Late Nights
channel.description: Recent content on Bits, Bytes, Late Nights

item.title: Algorithms
item.description: A master post for all of the additional resources I reference in my notes for Georgia Tech’s CS 6515: Graduate Algorithms.

item.title: Why (Not) Peer-to-Peer?
item.description: An overview of the Internet’s growth in the 2010s and some questions about what’s to come… With the current state of centralized content distribution, why aren’t we moving to a peer-to-peer model?

item.title: Notes
item.description: Graduate Algorithms, Applied Cryptography, and Machine Learning are the latest additions to the note family for the current Spring 2020 semester; these will be updated very frequently. Computational Perception — this guide provides a (relatively) gentle introduction to computer vision and computational photography. It starts with basic image processing, builds up to “old school” vision techniques, and eventually closes out with applications of machine learning algorithms to vision.

item.title: My Pescetarian Recipe Collection
item.description: A collection of tasty pescetarian recipes that I’ve gathered over the years with my personal tweaks and suggestions included.

item.title: Optimizing Sessionless Sessions
item.description: Or, arriving at the rationale behind the existence of JSON Web Tokens.

item.title: Tracking Your Every Move
item.description: Or, abusing MAC addresses for fun and profit (well, no profit unless you’re a massive corporation or the government…).

item.title: Hello there,
item.description: I’m George. I study computer science and sometimes cook things. I’m particularly interested in cryptography, peer-to-peer technologies, and applications of virtual and augmented reality. I like to write about these topics in various (albeit rare) posts. I also enjoy longboarding, rock climbing, and searching for the perfect nacho dish. You can also check out my $\LaTeX$'d notes for some of the graduate courses I’ve taken at the Georgia Institute of Technology.
